question: No, but I'm sure he's-- Just then, Tracy's CELLPHONE rings. She quickly answers it. Hello?
answer: Tracy, it's Vick. Parked on the dirt road behind Vick is his near-totalled 1967 Cadillac Deville convertible; it's scratched, dented, filthy - - and missing its passenger side door. Slouched inside are TWO OTHER GUYS, also looking like hell.

question: Hey Vick!
answer: Listen, honey...The bachelor party got a little out of control and, well...we lost Doug.

question: What?! But we're getting married in like four hours! Vick squints at the rising sun.
answer: Yeah, that's not gonna happen.

question: Checking in. Lennon comma Victor. The man types into his computer. Hold it right there, Atashir. This is my best friend from childhood, Douglas Billings. In two days, he is to marry a woman of great beauty and strong teeth, do you understand? A woman of gigantic bosoms who will give him many, many sons... Atashir looks confused. Alan looks embarrassed. My two other childhood friends have travelled great distances, across many deserts, to be here. This isn't a night in a hotel for us, Atashir Then I have but one question for you, friend
answer: No, sir.

question: Well, then. I think one of us needs to get back on his little computer and find us a suitable room. Atashir frowns...but types away at his computer.
answer: All the deluxe rooms are taken. The Dean Martin suite is available, but I'd have to ask my--

question: Dean-o will be fine. Send up a case of Cristal, two bottles of Patron, four ahi sandwiches, and a crate of skinless mangos... Vick turns to the guys: You guys want anything? The guys stammer, too stunned to speak. And have Jean-Marie cook up a dozen of those duck skewers I like so well. He knows the ones.
answer: And how would you like to pay?

question: So, you ready for Sunday?
answer: Yeah. I thought I'd be nervous, but I'm actually just really psyched. Alan nods, impressed.

question: Tracy's dad still hate you?
answer: Oh yeah.

question: Any closer to figuring out why?
answer: Enh, I think he wanted more for his girl. I mean, I'm a teacher who makes 45 grand a year, and he's a titan of industry who makes 45 grand a day, you know? I sort of get it... Also, I'm banging his daughter. I'm not sure you ever get past that. You got floss? Alan gestures towards his toiletries kit. Doug picks it up, starts looking for the floss. Then Alan remembers something -- but it's too late. Doug has found the RING BOX inside Alan's kit, and opened it to reveal a HUGE DIAMOND ENGAGEMENT RING. Holy Christ! Alan quickly reaches for the ring--

question: Yeah, what happened, Stuey?! You used to be able to drink us all under the table!
answer: Dude, I'm a dad! I don't have time to get plastered anymore! It blows!

question: What? No!
answer: Because my dad was a bad dad.

question: That's true, Stuey, but you're different. We've talked about this. Stu just stares at the guys, glassy-eyed. Beat.
answer: Have I showed you guys pictures of my kids yet--?

question: Damn, dude, why are you retarded? Both men are ragingly hungover. A long beat as both of them rub their faces, then: Um, Stuey?
answer: Yo.

question: Why do you have a mullet? Stu does, in fact, have a mullet haircut. But he's too hungover to understand.
answer: What?

question: You know, business on top, party down the back? Stu still looks confused. This is excruciating for Vick. Your hair, dude. You have a mullet. Stu touches his hair. Then he stumbles into the bathroom. After a beat, we hear his voice:
answer: Dude...I have a mullet. Then we hear ALAN'S VOICE in the bathroom, groggy:

question: Yeah. He's not here.
answer: Probably left him in the room. Vick pulls out his cell phone, starts dialing. I'll call his cell. Then a phone RINGS in Stu's pocket. He answers:

question: Good morning, this is Stu?
answer: It's me, meatdick.

question: Doug...? Doug...? Wake up, man. Alan enters the bedroom where Doug slept, and stops. It takes him a second to realize what's wrong: That's weird...
answer: No, no. It's cool, I'm a dad. It's totally cool...

question: I hate you all...
answer: DOUG! DOUG! Two GAY MEN in identical tank tops pass by, holding hands. Hey guys. DOUG! DOUG--! Then Stu registers what just happened. He stops and turns around -- enh? -- but the gay men are gone. Before he can comment, however, he sees Vick and Alan talking to Atashir at You find Doug?

question: Great. So we've officially lost Doug. His wedding is in what, 22 hours?
answer: Relax, it's Doug, he's probably crashed out on someone's couch right now. All we have to do is retrace our steps from last night, and we'll find him.

question: Okay, so last night... The guys wince, trying to remember. It's painful to think.
answer: Well, we started on the roof...

question: Right, that was like, 6ish...?
answer: Then...I think...we had steaks at the Palm?

question: Yeah. Then...we played craps at the Hard Rock...maybe?
answer: That sounds right... Stu throws up his arms, already giving up.

question: I vaguely recall...doing body shots ....at some point? Is that...maybe?
answer: I'm pretty much blank after The Hard Rock.

question: I think we went to the Flamingo after that...? And then, I just remember a lot of blue light...and the overpowering smell of baby oil.
answer: So that was what, 10ish?

question: Of course you're with Alan, you're both gutless cowards. But we're not calling Tracy. You never call the bride from the bachelor party. Ever. If my balls were on fire and Tracy was sitting next door with a tall glass of water, I still wouldn't call her. It's a rule.
answer: But shouldn't we at least tell her we're gonna be getting home late?

question: She has a watch, she'll figure it out.
answer: I think I'm beginning to see why you're always single.

question: And then I had those weird feelings for Vick that time in middle school, remember?! Everyone stops. Vick most of all.
answer: Um, what?

question: Yeah, that weekend we were all camping -- I told you this.
answer: Yeah, no you didn't.

question: I didn't?
answer: I think I'd remember, dude.

question: Wait -- so have either of you tested the waters?
answer: No! We're not gay!

question: How am I going to tell my wife?
answer: Quickly, and from a great distance. Alan's hand accidentally hits a brass railing and CLINKS...

question: We got a unicorn?!
answer: Oh, yeah, you got the entire Double Camelot Package. Alan just rubs his temples, oh no.

question: A-And how much did that cost?
answer: 7 thousand dollars. Alan closes his eyes. Stu and Vick exchange a look, no way! Yeah, you didn't want to get it, either, but Vick insisted. Beat. Then Alan pounces across the table at Vick!

question: I really don't appreciate being mocked right now, Alan, especially about wedding-related issues. You know how hard this weekend is going to be for me.
answer: I know, baby! I know--

question: So you'll call the credit card company and straighten this out?
answer: Yes. I will. I promise.

question: Okay. Okay... Look, sorry I'm so tense... I'll see you soon, okay? Love you. But Alan is just staring at the BRONZE SHIELD of him making out with his blonde bombshell wife... Alan? Hello? I said I love you?!
answer: Yes, no, I love you too! Becky hangs up, rolling her eyes, unbelievable. STAY WITH ALAN as he closes his cellphone. Exhales.

question: Hey, how's Becky doing, man?!
answer: Yeah, did she ask about us?! Off of Alan's hate-filled glare, we

question: Look on the bright side, Alan. Vick found a great clue.
answer: Turns out Doug was in all the wedding photos, which means -- if the time stamp was right -- we had him in our possession until 11 pm.

question: I paid 7 grand for Sbarro?!
answer: Your negativity is like a little black cloud over our car, Alan. You've got to let go of this.

question: Let go of what, exactly, Vick?! The fact that I married a complete stranger last night? Or that my girlfriend's about to leave me? Or that I'm broke? Which one?!
answer: You're broke? I thought you were

question: I know you think it's like terminally uncool to be in a committed relationship, Vick, but I actually love Becky, okay?
answer: Alan. Honey. Have you considered, even for a second, that maybe the things we do when we're drunk are what we secretly want to do?

question: Come on, let's toss the place. Alan starts wading through the crap in the living room, while Vick and Stu head off to check the bedrooms... Hey, check it out, Vick! I invested 30 grand in your custard store last night! Vick calls from the other bedroom.
answer: Smart move, man. Stu opens the closet door -- and freezes.

question: Hey, you wanna come in here a sec?! Vick enters a moment later to find Stu staring into the closet. Vick follows his gaze and sees a SEXY WOMAN snoring away on the closet floor, her blonde hair obscuring her face.
answer: Whoa.

question: You think she's what those Guamian dudes wanted?
answer: No. I think she's Alan's wife. Stu covers his mouth, oh shit! Vick produces the wallet- sized photos from Alan's wedding, compares them, and nods. Alan? Wanna step in here, buddy? A second later Alan enters, what's up? Alan, Chastity. Chastity, Alan. Alan looks down, sees Chastity SNORING on the closet floor, her body all contorted, and freezes. Oh my God.

question: You don't happen to remember what time we met you last night, do you?
answer: Sure, we met at the bar at like 10:00? Then we got married on my smoke break, which was like 11:00?

question: It's the All-American love story, isn't it? What happened next?
answer: Well, I had to go back to work. But when I got off at 5:30, I met up with you guys back here.

question: And was Doug with us then?
answer: No.

question: Interesting... Do you have any idea where we went after the wedding?
answer: No, but I bet some of my work friends do. You were partying with them pretty hard.

question: These were my bridesmaids, Anastasia and Starr!
answer: Please...don't. Just then a SPOTLIGHT finds Chastity and Alan, and the SLEAZY PONYTAILED DJ up in the booth comes over the P.A. system:

question: Oh my God, he's playing our song! This song was playing when we met, remember?! You kept sliding twenties into my thong and saying "I will always love you. I will always love you." Alan closes his eyes.
answer: Twenties?

question: Yeah, it was so sweet...
answer: Look, I don't know how to say this, but my friends and I were very drunk last night. We would never come to a place like this-- He glances over at Vick and Stu -- but they're gone. Guys?

question: What the hell are you doing?!
answer: Two-for-ones, man.

question: We don't have time for this! We gotta find Doug!
answer: What do you think we're doing?

question: What?
answer: We're getting into the mindset of last night, to see if it sparks any memories. Now Yeah, still no memories. Keep going -- and put your back into it.

question: You are so goddamn selfish, Vick. You really are. Stu, let's go.
answer: No. Stu, sit and enjoy your dance. Stu looks between them, torn.

question: Dude
answer: I'm trying to save your life here, Alan Mervish.

question: Vick--!
answer: I'm not kidding, man! Life is one long series of emergencies, and if you don't learn to stop and have a little fun along the way, you're gonna grow into a joyless old prick like your dad. I'm sorry to bring Moshe Mervish into it, but it had to be said. Now yes, we have 18 hours to find Doug -- which means we can afford to spend ten minutes celebrating the special talents of these gifted young body-artists. So sit down, have a jager shot, and smell the goddamn roses for once in your miserable life. Chastity, honey? When you're ready? Chastity pushes Alan onto the red leather banquette and starts dancing for him. He tries to squirm away:

question: I think I know why he married her.
answer: Because if he hadn't, I would've. They continue watching on in silence.

question: Is it weird that we're sitting this close watching?
answer: Not for me. More watching in silence.

question: I really shouldn't be here. I have daughters. Then both of their heads angle the same way.
answer: Not that can do that.

question: How can she do that without dislocating her hip?
answer: Because she's been touched by God. They continue staring, amazed. Just then, the door is kicked open and KIKIOLANI and KALOLO FANALUA burst into the Champagne Room, peering through the darkness, looking for our guys. Vick and Stu see them immediately. Shit. They both hop up. Alan remains sitting, however, hypnotized by Chastity. Vick grabs him. Alan, come on, man, we gotta go!

question: Did you have to be such a dick?!
answer: We got out, didn't we?

question: Yeah, four hours later! If we'd just cooperated with them--
answer: If we'd cooperated with them, we'd be in jail right now, Alan. They reach the curb, and Stu starts trying to hail a cab. Desperation is setting in.

question: Why hasn't he called? It's 8:30. The guys shake their heads, I don't know. Do you think he's okay--?
answer: Stu, don't. Doug is fine.

question: I mean, we were hanging out with mobsters last night, man! They kill people for looking at `em weird--!
answer: Stu

question: Or what if we like drove Doug out to the desert and left him, just as like a funny prank--?!
answer: Stu! Enough! What did you just say?

question: Stu! Enough! What did you just say?
answer: I said I knew I shouldn't have come this weekend, Vick!

question: Is that right?
answer: Yeah, that's right. I only came because Doug insisted. Vick steps towards Alan, heated.

question: Why do think you're so much better than us, dude?!
answer: I don't -- I just think I'm better than you, Vick! And trust me, it's not that hard! You haven't changed one bit since high school! Jesus, you're 28 years old and you still talk back to cops?! Really?!

question: You're out of your depth, Alan--
answer: And you're still the one getting us in trouble! Only then it was hiding your weed in our locker, and now you've got us partying with wanted felons! It's not cute anymore, man! We're too old for this! Vick scowls; this is actually hitting home... And all your stupid get-rich-quick schemes?! Girl-nasium?! Custard?! In Los Angeles?! Are you joking?!

question: Hey, Trace! W-What's going on?
answer: Oh, nothing, just here with my family...

question: Wow, that sounds amazing!
answer: Yeah...? Hey, you wouldn't happen to know where Doug is, would you? He said he'd be home by 5 for this dinner, and now it's almost 9:00. I tried his cell, but he didn't answer...

question: It's a fictitious canard, Alan, get over yourself! Stu
answer: Listen, Tracy, Alan fell on a

question: Fell over drunk.
answer: H-He was drunk. And the doctor -- a different doctor, not the one he fell on -- he said we couldn't move him until the wedding--

question: For a few hours! We'll be home before the wedding!
answer: But we're going to have the wedding at your home-- Tracy just looks really confused. Exasperated, Vick rips the phone away from Stu.

question: Tracy?! Vick! How are ya, hon?
answer: Vick, what is going on?

question: Nothing! Stu is a moron. Listen, Alan hurt his back last night, so we're gonna be laid up here for a bit, but I promise we'll have Doug home in time for the wedding, okay?
answer: Oh God, is Alan all right?

question: Yes, luckily he had a steel rod surgically implanted up his ass at birth, so the doctors anticipate a complete and swift recovery. Alan flips him the bird.
answer: Can I talk to Doug?

question: What? No! No, you can't actually, Doug...Doug is out.
answer: Where is he?

question: Where is he? He's aaaat...the pharmacy. Yeah, picking up Alan's medications. Listen, Trace, I'm losing you, but we'll see you tomorrow, okay? Bye, sweetie--! Vick hangs up and nods confidently. She bought it.
answer: They've done something stupid. Her stern father is standing there, frowning.

question: Yeah, I don't think we came here...
answer: Then why is your underwear nailed to the wall? The guys turn to see numerous pairs of MEN'S UNDERWEAR nailed to the wall nearby. A sign above it reads "CHAPS WALL OF FAME." We recognize Stu's COLORADO STATE BOXERS.

question: Those could be anybody's. Thousands of people go to Colorado State--
answer: Oh my God, are they autographed?

question: I am so gay... Just then, a BUFF WAITER in assless chaps blows by, smiling. R-Roger?
answer: Stay very close to me. She smiles and dances through the crowd.

question: Really? No memory? Stu shakes his head, wide-eyed, scared... Well, I must say, Stu, I'm a little hurt.
answer: Did we...you know...do anything?

question: Well, duh? Yeah?
answer: Was I...the boy or the girl?

question: You were pretty mellow at first, Stu, but once we got you into the chaps, you really came alive-- oh, here it is.
answer: I'm a Dad, I-I don't get to the gym as much as I'd like...

question: You even taught us The Pony, which we'd never even heard of before... ON THE TV Stu gets on all fours on the stage, and eagerly gestures for the dancers to take turns "riding" him. Stu's face drops. And then, of course, the pice de resistance
answer: Annnnd that would explain the searing ass pain.

question: Hello?
answer: Mr. Lennon?

question: Atashir, many greetings to you.
answer: I thought you might like to know that one of our maids just found your friend, Douglas, passed out in your room. Vick's jaw drops.

question: What?! Are you sure it's him?!
answer: I saw him with my own eyes. He is unconscious but breathing nicely.

question: This has officially been the craziest weekend of my life. Thanks for all your help. You were awesome.
answer: Anything for my hubby. Alan's smile flickers slightly. I'm kidding, Alan. I know last night wasn't, you know, real... She looks out at Vegas as it flies by.

question: I'm sorry about all this, Chastity.
answer: Jennifer.

question: Beg pardon?
answer: My name is Jennifer. Jennifer Elly. Alan hesitates; suddenly she seems a lot more...human.

question: Okay, well, I'm sorry, Jennifer.
answer: Oh, don't be. Last night wasn't the first flaky decision I've ever made in my life. I mean, I am a stripper. Alan tries not to laugh. She smiles, a twinge sadly.

question: Where you from?
answer: LA. Tarzana.

question: Oh yeah?
answer: Yeah. I work here on the weekends.

question: You fly out every week?
answer: Yeah. I'd move, but my kid is in a great school.

question: Jesus, guys! This is the girl I'm going to marry! If, you know...she forgives me for cheating on her...
answer: Wait

question: Of course I'm going to tell her! I could never keep something like that from her.
answer: Dude, she still hasn't forgiven me for scratching her Queensryche CD in sixth grade -- she's neeeeever gonna forgive you for marrying a stripper in Vegas.

question: Listen, Mr. Lang, whatever we did last night, we are incredibly sorry-
answer: These your rich friends you were telling me about, Vick? Alan and Stu glance at Vick, confused. Oh, you haven't told them yet? Really, that's low. Even for you.

question: What's going on, Vick? Vick stammers, trying to find the words...
answer: Six months ago, your friend Vick borrowed some money from me at what can only be described as a very unfavorable interest rate. When the loan came due, he failed to pay me back, but he promised me that he could get the money from you guys this weekend. Alan and Stu look at Vick, shocked and hurt.

question: They were gonna hurt me, man...
answer: Well, Vick, it looks like you and your friends have some issues to discuss. In the meantime... He draws a huge, red-plated .357 MAGNUM. I need my goddamn money. The guys jump back, whoa! Vick holds up his hands:

question: I can get it! I can! I just--
answer: I've heard that before, Vick, including last night, when you so rudely skipped out on my birthday party. That's why I've taken some collateral to ensure your payment. His name is Doug. The guys all look sick.

question: Is that true, Vick? Vick just stares out at the city, not denying it. Were any of your deals...real? Dude, I manage an Applebee's, that money meant something to me... Vick spins around, furious:
answer: Do you really think I wanted my life to turn out like this, Stu?! Do you really think I don't know that I'm a massive loser?! Jesus, you guys got out of high school and you just knew what to do, you went to college and got good jobs and found cool wives and made beautiful children -- what do I have to show for the last decade of my life?! Nothing! Vick swats a lamp off a nearby end-table -- it SMASHES against the wall! The guys freeze. Tense silence. Vick grows emotional. Jesus, I'm almost 30, and the only thing I really have...the only thing I really have is you guys.

question: Come on, Vick--
answer: No, man, it's true! I put on a good show, but my life is so goddamn hollow and vapid and lonely, it scares me, man. I-I don't know how much longer I can keep this scam going. And now I've gone and ruined the one good thing I had... Tears threaten in his eyes. He wipes at them, angry. Just...please don't give up on me, okay? I-I don't know what I'd do without you guys. I really don't... Alan and Stu exchange a look. They've never seen brash, cocky Vick this vulnerable before. Stu can't help but give in.

question: Come on, man, we've been bro's since third grade, it's gonna take a lot more than money to ruin our friendship. Vick looks down, deeply touched... What I don't understand is why you didn't just ask me for the money. I would've given you every last cent I had, man... I love you, man.
answer: Love you too, bro. Love you too. They hug tight. For a while.

question: Also, I banged your sister sophomore year. Vick pulls away.
answer: What?!

question: Sorry. Just seemed like a good time to tell you. Vick stammers at Stu, speechless. She had just broken up with that guy from Central, we were playing "I Never" at Tim Donahee's pool, one thing lead to another--
answer: No! No. That's...that's plenty. Vick desperately tries to clear the image from his mind. Alan just frowns at his watch, stressed.

question: Time check!
answer: 12 minutes.

question: Chip check! Faster! Come on chip check!
answer: Dude, how many Red Bulls have you had?

question: It's not red... Stu turns, ecstatic-- It's green. The ball has stopped on green, DOUBLE ZERO. Stu clutches his chest, like he's having a seizure. Vick inhales, grim. Alan slowly drops to his knees. Chastity closes her eyes. Their HUGE PILE OF CHIPS is raked off the table...
answer: Would you like me to come with?

question: No...It might get a little dangerous. I wouldn't want... He trails off. Chastity nods.
answer: I'm so sorry...about everything.

question: Thanks for all your help. Awkward silence. The cold desert wind blows.
answer: There's no sense...in exchanging numbers or anything...right?

question: Yeah, probably not... Alan looks genuinely sad.
answer: Well...I'll always remember you as a great first husband, then. They both smile weakly. You can just send the divorce papers to the Crazy Horse or whatever... Alan nods, okay. Another awkward pause. Thanks for reminding me that there are still some really good guys out there, Alan. I don't...I don't get to meet too many of them. She smiles a bit sadly, kisses him on the cheek, and walks off. TIGHT ON Alan's Grandmother's ring still on her finger. Alan doesn't remember the ring, however; he's too busy watching her walk out of his life, and feeling a real sense of loss... Then Vick fires up the car next to him.

question: Alan I need you positive please.
answer: Here they come. They all look up to see a WHITE YUKON approaching on the far horizon, kicking up a trail of dust. The guys tense up.

question: Stuart?
answer: Yeah?

question: Let's see Doug! Jimmy Lang nods to Kalolo, who opens the back door of the Yukon and pulls out a GUY with his hands tied behind his back and a plastic RALPH'S BAG over his head; he struggles a bit. The guys look a bit alarmed.
answer: Jesus, what'd they do to him?

question: Pull off the Ralph's bag! Jimmy yanks the bag off of the guy's head to reveal Who the hell is that?!
answer: Oh my God

question: Yeah, you got the wrong Doug, man!
answer: You sure?!

question: Yeah, man, our Doug is white!
answer: But you were partying with this guy at my birthday thing!

question: I don't know what to tell you, bro, this isn't the Doug we requested!
answer: Well. I apologize for the mix-up... But I'm still gonna need my money. Vick and the guys start backtracking towards their car.

question: Who wants to make the call? Beat. Then Vick reaches for his nose, odd man out. Stu and Alan immediately reach for their noses, too. It's close.
answer: That was you!

question: What?! No! I beat you by a mile!
answer: Vick, who won?!

question: No, but I'm sure he's-- Just then, Tracy's CELL PHONE rings. She quickly answers it. Hello?
answer: In the desert, on the pay phone, looking through his busted aviators into the rising sun. Tracy, it's Vick.

question: Hey Vick!
answer: Listen, honey...The bachelor party got a little out of control and, well...we lost Doug.

question: What?! But we're getting married in like four hours!
answer: Yeah, that's not gonna happen... Look, I'm really sorry, Trace. This is all my fault-- What the--?! Alan gets on the phone with Tracy, his heart racing.

question: How'd you figure it out?!
answer: The Patron, man! It reminded me of our first drink of the night!

question: Honestly, dude, you're a genius. He's on the roof! Stu looks confused, the roof?
answer: After Doug passed out, we must've taken him up there in his bed as a prank, so he'd wake up on the roof or whatever? Then we forgot him.

question: Okay, okay, I'll go with you. Just...don't ruin the wedding. Then JIMMY LANG enters the bathroom on RED CRUTCHES.
answer: I really didn't want it to end like this, Vick. Vick nods, resigned, and starts towards him. Then Jimmy extends his hand for Vick to shake. Good luck.

question: Um, what...?
answer: Your friend Alan just paid your marker. Took out a second mortgage on his house. The full 200 grand, plus medical expenses, which I thought was a classy touch. Vick looks blown away. Without our friends, we are nothing, Vick. Remember that. The three injured mobsters exit. Vick remains standing there, overwhelmed, his life literally saved...
